official-title.#text:
To direct the Interagency Task Force to Monitor and Combat Trafficking to identify strategies to
			 prevent children from becoming victims of trafficking and review
			 trafficking prevention efforts, to protect and assist in the recovery of
			 victims of trafficking, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#text: Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Human Trafficking Prevention, Intervention, and Recovery Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Human Trafficking Prevention, Intervention, and Recovery Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Interagency task force report on child trafficking primary prevention

text.#text: The Interagency Task Force to Monitor and Combat Trafficking, established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall conduct
			 a review that, with regard to trafficking in persons in the United States—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 105 of the
			 Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000

text.#text:
in consultation with nongovernmental organizations that the Task Force determines appropriate,
			 surveys and catalogues the activities of the Federal Government and State
			 governments to deter individuals from committing trafficking offenses and
			 to prevent children from becoming victims of trafficking;

surveys academic literature on deterring individuals from committing trafficking offenses,
			 preventing children from becoming victims of trafficking, the commercial
			 sexual exploitation of children, and other similar topics that the Task
			 Force determines appropriate;

identifies best practices and effective strategies to deter individuals from committing trafficking
			 offenses and to prevent children from becoming victims of trafficking; and

identifies current gaps in research and data that would be helpful in formulating effective
			 strategies to deter individuals from committing trafficking offenses and
			 to prevent children from becoming victims of trafficking.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and make
			 publicly available in electronic format, a report on the review conducted
			 pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Human Trafficking Prevention, Intervention, and Recovery Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

text.#text:
Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Interagency Task Force to
			 Monitor and Combat Trafficking shall provide to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Comptroller General
			 of the United States

text.#text: On the date that is one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

information on the efforts of Federal and select State law enforcement agencies to combat human
			 trafficking in the United States; and

information on each Federal grant program, a purpose of which is to combat human trafficking or
			 assist victims of trafficking, as specified in an authorizing statute or
			 in a guidance document issued by the agency carrying out the grant
			 program.

quote.#text: , including programs that provide housing to victims of trafficking

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by inserting before the period at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 107(b)(2)(A) of the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000

header.#text: Provision of housing permitted to protect and assist in the recovery of victims of trafficking

quote.#tail: has the meaning given such term in

text.#text: In this Act, the term and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 103 of the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5135 IH: Human Trafficking Prevention, Intervention, and Recovery Act of 2014
